title: MIMIC 4
text:
Github
  

  
  
This is the documentation website for MIMIC4 project.
MIMIC4 is based on the PhysioNet MIMIC IV database, which is openly accessible however require credentials. Please refer to the official guide for how to acquire the correct access.
This documentation is for personal use and going through active development, so please use with caution. Feedback can be made by either creating an issue or reaching out to me directly.

title: MIMIC 4
text:
Information for MIMIC IV here

Modules: hosp and icu (metavision)

hosp
546.028 stays, 223.452 unique individuals
also has intra-hospital transfers
De-identification: date shifting, done independently for each patient


icu (not now)
94.458 stays

title: Projects overview
text:
The overall motivations are such that the following skills are developed and demonstrated:

Database: SQL and BigQuery
Cloud: such as GCP, Vertex AI
Data and feature engineering with python
Machine learning: Tensorflow / Keras, predictive modeling and classification
Hardware: CPU, GPU and beyond (TPU)

There are two planned projects that derive from the MIMIC IV data.

Project 1
This is a continuation of ggehr, where the derived data will be used as demonstration for the R package.
Purpose of this project for myself:

technical skills: SQL
familiarity of MIMIC IV data, understand which tables are relevant and lead to the next project







Skills to demonstrate




SQL and BigQuery
Google Cloud + Gemini
Visualization with ggplot2
R package development and testing




Impact






Tip



Check the relevant areas to demonstrate, such as visualization, patient insight â€¦




End products

an abstract for talk at ISCB46 in Basel (due 2.14)
R package ggehr accepted in CRAN




Project 2
This is a project to practice programming and statistical skills using healthcare data. This can be considered as a project extension for Paper 1 in my PhD, but less focus on model performance, more on the interview preparation.
Purpose of this project for myself:

technical skills: SQL, python, ML


Impact






Tip




The endpoint selection will be important if want to demonstrate the usefulness of the ML models
Predictive modeling
patient segregation?









Skills demonstrated




python
feature engineering
tensorflow / keras
predictive modeling / classification
test out BigQueryML / autoML, vertex AI
test out different hardware on Google Cloud

title: Data processing
text:
Understand which tables and variables are relevant

To reproduce the demo cohort, can use the subject_id from MIMIC-IV Clinical Database Demo.
Note the following tables are from mimiciv_3_1_hosp.



Index
Table
Relevant Columns
Maybe




1
admissions
subject_id,  admittime,  dischtime, deathtime,  admission_type
hadm_id


2
patients
subject_id,  gender
